abstract: Supreme Court restores parental rights to adoptive mother of three children from same-sex partnership; rules that initial adoption decree in Georgia must be honored by Alabama as well; other Supreme Court news noted.

headline.print_headline: An Adoptive Mother of 3 Wins Right to Visitation
headline.main: Supreme Court Restores Visitation Rights to Lesbian Adoptive Mother

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The court ruled that the Alabama Supreme Court had erred in refusing visitation because it disagreed with Georgia laws allowing same-sex couples to adopt.
lead_paragraph: The court ruled that the Alabama Supreme Court had erred in refusing visitation because it disagreed with Georgia laws allowing same-sex couples to adopt.
